CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1941, pg. 19, reads: "The Triedstone Baptist church Sunday school, located on the corner of Washington and Sixth Avenues, Aliquippa, with H. D. Durr, superintendent, and C. R. Brown, assistant superintendent. There are 16 regular teachers and 16 assistants. The school is one of the largest in Western Pennsylvania. The teachers and assistants are instructed Tuesday of each week by the capable Rev. William Harris. The pupils of the school are remembered by the teachers with special gifts at Christmas and Easter. Some of the outstanding teachers of the school are D. B. Harvey, Mrs. Hilda Nelins, Mrs. pg. L. Anderson, Mrs. I. M. Dempsey, Mrs. Irene Harvey, Miss Anabel Denson, Mrs. Lucille Covington, Mrs. E. Drake, Mrs. Emma Phelps, John Myers, Timothy McCay, Miss Lucille Beckom, Miss Hulda Campbell, Mrs. Hattie Baker, Mrs. Francis Perkins. Henrietta Doby is organist and Charlotte Meade is secretary. - Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of children, women, and men, from Triedstone Baptist church Sunday School, posed in front of public school building erected in 1917, Aliquippa, another version
